intro: Cupania excelsa, commonly known as the tall cupania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Cupania excelsa is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and potential horticultural applications.
